snippet: Many North Korean children are stunted from malnutrition, and two-thirds of the country’s people do not know where their next meal is coming from, the United Nations said.
abstract: United Nations says more than one fourth of all North Korean children are stunted from chronic malnutrition, and two-thirds of country's 24 million people do not know where their next meal is coming from.
lead_paragraph: Many North Korean children are stunted from malnutrition, and two-thirds of the country’s people do not know where their next meal is coming from, the United Nations said.

headline.main: North Korea: U.N. Team Finds High Level of Chronic Malnutrition
headline.print_headline: North Korea: U.N. Team Finds High Level of Chronic Malnutrition
